q: could take longer.'' In a statement provided by Allen Iverson 's manager, Gary Moore , Andrews said Allen Iverson probably won't be able to return for ''six to eight weeks or more.'' At this point it is certainly more important to get[ Allen Iverson 's] calf healed and asymptomatic than it is to try to play with continued pain, Andrews wrote. The injury prompted Allen Iverson to leave his current team, Besiktas of the Turkish League, to return to the United States for treatment. to Oprah Winfrey on her Master Class show, the 51-year-old music mogul recalled being kicked out of a meeting with an unknown network executive while trying to sell the singing competition with then-partners Simon Fuller and Simon Cowell Jones. It was so bad that a minute into the pitch the guy said ''No'. To wind him up, I said,` So, it sounds like you're interested?' He said` Get out' and we were thrown out of the network. ''I turned to the other Simons and said,` The good news is, it will never get worse than this''...[ I left with] my tail between my legs. . Hemmed in by a strict curfew, Zahi Hawass spent the night at home fretting about the fate of his country's treasures. ''Of course I was so worried,'' he said. I have been protecting antiquities all my life. I felt if the Cairo museum is robbed, Egypt will never be able to get up again. Early Saturday, Zahi Hawass fought the mobs to reach the museum. '' he said. ''Larry, Sergey Brin and I have worked exceptionally closely together for over a decade-- and we anticipate working together for a long time to come.'' Page praised Eric Schmidt for an outstanding job leading Google for the last decade. ''There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly, he said. '' Eric Schmidt is a tremendous leader and I have learned innumerable lessons from him. His advice and efforts will be invaluable to me as I start in this new role,'' he said
